newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London higher in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London higher in thin trade.

text.p: Japanese shares were firmer following a higher finish in Tokyo overnight but trading volumes remained light as many investors were absent on Friday due to the Christmas holidays.
"We've seen some buying after the sell-off earlier this week but with volumes so low it is too early to say we've seen the bottom," one dealer said.
"People are still pretty nervous about the new (Japanese) budget and its implications for the economy."
The Nikkei/ISE 50 share index was up 34.06 points at 1,426.25 by 1015 GMT.
In Tokyo on Monday, stocks clawed higher, lifted by bargain-hunting but investors remained wary after the Nikkei average plunged below the 19,000 level on Thursday, dealers said.
The Nikkei 225 ended Friday's session, 77.46 points higher at 19,369.04. Trading on London's equities markets ends at 1230 GMT today.
